intro: Phymaspermum villosum, commonly known as the hairy phymaspermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are covered in fine, hairy texture. Phymaspermum villosum is characterized by its compact growth habit and drought-resistant adaptations. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
